result.title: Persistent Segment Trees
result.content:
Hi!

Can someone explain how to store persistent segment trees (and whether or not pointers in C++ are required). I understand that segment trees have to be built for all ranges in an array, and we can condense the memory and runtime by adding on to a segment tree, but I don't understand how to do that. If you have a segment tree that is already built, and want to add log(n) nodes, wouldn't you have to copy the entire segment tree over again, and then add the log(n) nodes? Could someone please clarify this.

Thanks in advance, memset123
